intro: Psychotria portus-finschii, commonly known as the Finsch's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Psychotria portus-finschii is also noted for containing alkaloids, which can have psychoactive properties.
